intro: Inversodicraea koukoutamba, commonly known as the Koukoutamba tree, is a rare and endemic species native to the rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
